broadcast.list.info:
A mailing list is a way to communicate with a large number of users within a community or school.

Mailing lists are visible on shared screens, but the names of the members are hidden. p>

This type of group can be created by a central admin, so you’ll need to direct your mailing list requests to the support teams.p>

Changes that have been made to mailing lists are updated every evening.

Only one profile per mailing list can be selected.

import.classesChecking.info.1: The import will associate classes automatically when possible.
import.classesChecking.info.2: If no associations are found for a class, the message "the class “class_name” will be created” will appear
import.classesChecking.info.3: You can then manually associate classes. This will resolve naming errors that result in duplicate classes
import.classesChecking.info.4: If you leave the message "the class “class_name” will be created” , the class will be added to the database
import.classesChecking.success: All classes have been recognized. You can move on to the next step
import.classesChecking.success.noClasses: There are no classes to associate. You can move on to the next step

import.deleteAccountOption: Pre-delete user accounts not included in the files
import.error.file.separator: Invalid delimiter: The files must be saved in .csv format (semi-colon deliminated)
import.error.malformedFiles: Files cannot be imported due to the errors highlighted in red: <strong>You must edit the files<strong>
import.error.noColumnsMappingFound: Column field association data not found. Check that your files have a header line.
import.error.requieredFieldNotFound.glob: We were not able to find one or several required fields in this file. <strong>You must associate the file manually<strong>
import.fieldsChecking.success: All fields have been recognized. You can proceed to the next step.
import.fieldsChecking.warning.ignore.1: The field {{value}} in your file could not be identified and will not be imported
import.file.warning: This file contains warnings that do not prevent the file from being loaded
import.finish.notabene.sync: Please note: After importing, the class data might not be synchronized on the User window. In this case, refresh the User window by pressing the F5 key.
import.global.error: The files that you would like to import contain the following errors:

import.header.selectFile: Select the profiles that you would like to import
import.info.columns.Guest: The guest file must contain the following fields: Last name and First name
import.info.columns.Personnel: The staff file must contain the following fields: Last name and First name
import.info.columns.Relative: The relative file must contain the following fields: Last name, First name, and Child’s external ID (Childexternalid)
import.info.columns.Student: The student file must contain the following fields: Last name, First name, birth date, and classes
import.info.columns.Teacher: The teacher file must contain the following fields: Last name and First name
import.info.deleteAccount.1: User accounts from CSV files only that are not included in the files will be automatically pre-deleted. These users will be able to sign into the VLE to recover their data for up to 90 days after this date. Their accounts will then be permanently deleted.
import.info.file.0: User instructions for importing CSV files
import.info.file.1: Here you can create and/or update user accounts by importing CSV files, whether compiled by hand or created by a software, especially ONDE exports. It is important to follow the steps below:
import.info.file.2: - A separate file must be created for each user profile (students, parents, teachers, staff, and guests).
import.info.file.3: - The student file must be uploaded before the parent file.
import.info.file.4: - Please note: Processing the parent files can sometimes take several minutes.
import.info.file.5: - The file templates are available through the following links: teachers, students, parents, staff, guests
import.info.file.6: The files must be saved in .csv format (comma-separated).
import.info.file.7: For each file, the columns in the template files indicated by an asterisk must be filled out.
import.info.transition.2: - All classes not included in the file will be deleted
import.info.transition.3: - Existing classes and class groups will be deleted.
import.info.transition.4: - Anything that has been shared with these classes and groups will also be deleted.
import.info.transition.5: - Only class group communication rules will be reset to default settings.

management.structure.informations.name.h: This information is visible in the directory and whenever it is shared
The default name will be reset at the next import.
management.structure.informations.source: Opting for automatic account importing means that the data are transmitted from your school district. User accounts should primarily be verified (adding/updating accounts) using academic software (SCONET, SIECLE, STSweb, etc.).

A manual information source means that the school must enter data into user accounts itself. To do so, you must create accounts one by one or import accounts via a CSV file in the Import/export section of the Admin Console.
